channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Pakistan partially reopens Torkham border crossing to allow Afghan refugees to leave
item.description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan (AP) — Pakistan on Saturday partially reopened the Torkham border crossing with Afghanistan to allow thousands of stranded Afghan refugees to return home, officials said. Restrictions remain on all other cross-border movement, including trade.
item.dc:creator: RIAZ KHAN, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Latest remains returned from Gaza are not bodies of hostages, Israel says
item.description: Israel says the remains of three people handed over by Hamas to the Red Cross this week do not belong to any of the hostages.
item.dc:creator: Renata Brito, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Tanzanian President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan has won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Wicker, Reed demand Hegseth share Caribbean strike orders
item.description: Sens. Jack Reed (D-R.I.) and Roger Wicker (R-Miss.) on Friday called on Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to give them copies of the orders issued to strike boats in the Caribbean that the Trump administration says were trafficking drugs. They released two letters addressed to Hegseth.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Mancini, The Hill

item.title: Protesters call for governor’s resignation after Rio’s deadliest police raid
item.description: Hundreds of protesters have marched through Vila Cruzeiro favela, demanding the resignation of Rio de Janeiro state Gov. Cláudio Castro.
item.dc:creator: Eléonore Hughes, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Trump won't send 'high level' representatives to COP30 climate summit
item.description: The U.S. won’t be sending any “high level” representatives to this year’s United Nations climate summit, a White House official told The Hill on Friday. The summit, known as COP30, will be held in Brazil next month.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Frazin, The Hill

item.title: Trump opens the door for sanctions on Nigeria over persecution of Christians
item.description: President Donald Trump has opened the door for sanctions to be imposed on Nigeria for allegedly failing to rein in the persecution of Christians in the country.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Lee, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: U.S. national intelligence director Tulsi Gabbard says America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” has ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Jon Gambrell, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Pakistan says it seeks no further escalation but urges Afghanistan to act against militants
item.description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Pakistan does not seek further escalation of hostilities with Afghanistan but expects the South Asian country's Taliban rulers to address its security concerns by taking action against militants operating from Afghan soil, Pakistan’s Foreign Ministry said Friday.
item.dc:creator: MUNIR AHMED, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Royal prerogative: King Charles III banishes Andrew to buttress the House of Windsor's foundations
item.description: No one is bigger than the monarchy. Not even the king’s brother. In the end, that reality spelled the end of Andrew’s life as a prince of the realm.
item.dc:creator: DANICA KIRKA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Prince Andrew moves to Sandringham
item.description: Unlike other properties that the royal family inhabits through the Crown Estate, Sandringham is privately owned by the king.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Grant, NewsNation

item.title: UN human rights chief calls on Pentagon to halt strikes on suspected drug boats
item.description: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk called for the Pentagon to halt boat strikes against vessels suspected to be carrying drugs in order to prevent “extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: Aid teams flock to Jamaica to help with Hurricane Melissa recovery
item.description: David Archer, deputy governor of the British Virgin Islands, told NewsNation he's seen many organizations eager to help.
item.dc:creator: Anna Kutz, NewsNation

item.title: Latvian Parliament votes to withdraw from domestic violence treaty
item.description: WARSAW, Poland (AP) — The Latvian Parliament voted Thursday to withdraw from the Istanbul Convention, a treaty aimed at supporting women who are victims of violence, after a 13-hour session of intense debate.
item.dc:creator: CLAUDIA CIOBANU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: US defense chief vows to 'stoutly defend' Indo-Pacific interests in talks with China
item.description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia (AP) — The U.S. Secretary of Defense said Friday he told his Chinese counterpart during talks in Malaysia that Washington would “stoutly defend” its interests in the Indo-Pacific. He also signed a new agreement aimed at strengthening security ties with India.
item.dc:creator: EILEEN NG, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — The rumble of large machinery, whine of chain saws and chopping of machetes echoed through communities across the northern Caribbean on Thursday as they dug out from the destruction of Hurricane Melissa and surveyed the damage left behind.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Death toll from Rio de Janeiro police raid on drug gang rises to 121
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — The death toll in a massive police raid targeting a drug trafficking gang in Rio de Janeiro rose to at least 121 people, authorities said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES and GABRIELA SÁ PESSOA, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ultra-Orthodox protesters in Jerusalem rally over Israel’s draft exemption as clashes break out
item.description: Ultra-Orthodox protesters flooded Jerusalem to oppose military draft requirements, adding further pressure on the government of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Fate of thousands feared in Darfur after reported rampage by Sudanese paramilitary force
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — Sudanese fleeing a paramilitary force that seized a city in the country’s Darfur region trickled into a nearby refugee camp Thursday after walking for miles, telling aid workers that roads were littered with bodies.
item.dc:creator: SARAH EL DEEB and FARNOUSH AMIRI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: King Charles strips Andrew of 'prince' title, evicts him
item.description: The royal family has been under pressure from the public to strip Andrew of his titles because of his association with Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: Prince Andrew dragged out negotiations before banishment for cash: Source
item.description: Asked if there was a “number” Andrew had in mind, the source said, “I think a couple of million would go a long way.
item.dc:creator: Paula Froelich, NewsNation

item.title: 5 more arrests as Louvre jewel heist probe deepens and key details emerge
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The dragnet tightened around the Louvre thieves on Thursday. Five more people were seized in the crown-jewels heist — including a suspect tied by DNA — the Paris prosecutor said, widening the sweep across the capital and its suburbs.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ADAMSON and ANGELA CHARLTON, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: 5 deals Trump, Xi struck in South Korea
item.description: President Trump emerged from his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday touting agreements on tariffs, rare earth exports and soybean purchases as the two superpowers reached truces on key issues.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, The Hill

item.title: Red Cross receives two coffins of deceased hostages in Gaza Strip, IDF says
item.description: Israel said the Red Cross reported receiving "two coffins of deceased hostages" during a transfer in the Gaza Strip and is brining the remains to IDF troops.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Tariffs, trade and TikTok: Takeaways from Trump-Xi meeting
item.description: Trump said he and China’s Xi left the nearly two-hour meeting with newfound solidarity on a laundry list of issues.
item.dc:creator: Libbey Dean, NewsNation

item.title: Trump has 'leverage' to stop Sudan killings as satellite images reveal mass deaths: Yale researchers
item.description: Yale researchers document evidence of atrocities in Sudan's El Fasher using satellite imagery, while U.S. intelligence confirms UAE weapons transfers to the Rapid Support Forces.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: At least 64 killed in Rio police raids ahead of climate conferences
item.description: Police have often conducted large-scale operations against criminal groups ahead of major events in Rio.
item.dc:creator: Rodrigo Viga Gaier / Reuters, NewsNation

item.title: Evacuation is not an option for 3 Virginia couples in Jamaica
item.description: A Category 5 hurricane is bearing down on Jamaica, and three Virginia couples are stuck there unable to fly home ahead of the storm.
item.dc:creator: Regina Mobley, NewsNation

item.title: Suspects arrested over the theft of crown jewels from Paris' Louvre museum
item.description: PARIS (AP) — Two suspects were arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, justice and police officials said Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world and sparked a massive manhunt.
item.dc:creator: SAMUEL PETREQUIN and NICOLAS GARRIGA, Associated Press, WFLA, NBC
